module.p: aithne knowledge, acquaintance is a feminine simple common noun.

Examples from dictionaries and grammars –
An aithne dhuibh e? Chan aithne.
Do you know him? No. td. 15

Examples from Gairm –
[...] Bha Mairead ’na suidhe ann an cathair ris an teine is plaide timcheall air a glùinean. Bha Màiri a’ deanamh na dìnneir. Dh’ innis e dhaibh gur esan an duine a sgrìobh thuca, a dh’ fhaighneachd am b’ urrainn dha a thighinn. [...] Shuidh e air cathair. “Tha sinn airson feadhainn de na h-òrain as aithne dhuibh a chur air clàr, gus nach teid iad air chall.” [...]
[...] Margaret was sat in a chair by the fire with a blanket around her knees. Mary was making the dinner. He told them that he was the man who had written to them, asking if he could come. [...] He sat [down] on a chair. “We are wanting to put some of the songs that you know on record, so that they are not lost.” [...] td. 169–70, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn

Other examples from modern usage –
’S e Tòmas an aon chroitear as aithne dhomh a dh’èirich gu inbhe taidhcùn. Rinn e sin tro dhìcheall, obair chruaidh agus tàlant malairt a bha neo-ghnàthach. An-diugh tha iomadh companaidh na ainm air feadh na Gàidhealtachd. [...]
Thomas is the only crofter I know who has risen to the status of a tycoon. He did that through duty, hard work and a talent for business that was unusual. Today there are many companies in his name all over the Highlands. [...] td. 5

Examples from dictionaries and grammars –
cuir aithne air
get to know, get acquainted td. 15
aithnich know, recognise, experience. Verbal noun: aithneachadh. Alternatives: faithnich, faithneachadh.

Examples from dictionaries and grammars –
Aithnichidh sinn a-rithist sibh.
We’ll know/recognise you another time. td. 15
Chan aithnichinn e ged thachradh e nam bhrochan orm.
I wouldn’t know him if I met him in my gruel. td. 15 proverb
Cha do dh’aithnich ar sinnsearan na duilgheadasan a th’ againn a-nis.
Our ancestors didn’t know/experience the problems we have now. td. 15

Examples from modern usage –
Bha a h-uile duine a dh’aithnicheadh e a’ smaoineachadh gu robh beatha shòlasach aig Ailig Smart. [...] Thòisich e na bhalach le aon eathar ghiomach ag obair a-mach à Malaig, agus aig an àm seo bha e air a mheas na dhuine beairteach. Bha trì bàtaichean mòr aige, agus bha e a’ reic iomadh seòrsa maoraich anns an Fhraing agus anns an Spàinn. [...]
Everybody who got [would get] to know him thought that Alec Smart had a good life. [...] He started with one lobster boat working out of Mallaig, and at this time he had been regarded as a wealthy man. He had three large boats, and he sold many types of shellfish in France and in Spain. [...] td. 103
